Key Match Events: Ben Stokes came to England’s rescue in their final Super 12s match against Sri Lanka in Sydney, helping them reach the T20 World Cup semi-finals.
England stumbled from 75 without loss after 7.1 overs to 129 for six, requiring 13 from the final 12 balls.
Ben Stokes steered England to a final-over win over Sri Lanka.
Jos Buttler (28 off 23 balls) and Alex Hales (47 off 30) got England off to a flyer but both perished to Wanindu Hasaranga.
The spin trio of Wanindu Hasaranga, Dhananjaya de Silva, and Maheesh Theekshana conceded just 69 runs across a combined 12 overs.
Adil Rashid took his first tournament wicket, finishing with figures of 4-0-16-1, while Mark Wood chipped in with three for 26.
Post-Match Reflections: Jos Buttler hailed the 'sense of calm' that Ben Stokes provides after the all-rounder kept his composure to usher England into the T20 World Cup semi-finals.
Buttler expressed relief at finding a way to win despite not enjoying the tense moments.
Sri Lanka head coach Chris Silverwood tipped Stokes to shine for the remainder of the tournament.
Miscellaneous Highlights: England, who go through alongside New Zealand in their group, will likely face India in Adelaide on Thursday.
Dawid Malan is a doubt for the next match after pulling up sharply while chasing the ball in the outfield.
